entry.title: new bitcoin.org clients page
entry.summary: The email conversation mainly focuses on the comparison of different Bitcoin clients, namely Bitcoin-Qt, MultiBit, Armory, Electrum, and Bitcoin Wallet. Each client is described in terms of its requirements, whether it requires the entire blockchain or a reduced one, its design for continuous or occasional use, availability for different platforms, development language, and website link. The discussion also includes a suggestion to replace "designed for occasional use" with a more specific description, such as "designed for advanced users" or "designed for quick setup and instant usability". In addition, Armory is highlighted as being designed to be the only wallet if bitcoind is running in the background, and it now has full installers for Windows and Linux with uninstallers and automatic URI registration. Another part of the email conversation is about email etiquette, specifically regarding the use of "Reply to All" and the issue of duplicated recipients. There is also a link to an article that discusses the harmful effects of "Reply-To" munging.
